page.title: 09FLORA AND FAUNA (2)
page.content: The vegetation is mostly purple moor grass and mat grass. Where it is drier heather flourishes and in a few places one occasionally finds bilberries. Lower down on the improved pastures there are rushes, where there is better grazing. In the marshy parts, cotton flowers flourish in spring, and later wild yellow iris form a splash of colour just to the side of the road above the reservoir. The woodland in the north-east is mainly deciduous and there is some new planting of beech copses, extending up the inflow stream at the bend of the Tockholes road. This has been done by the North West Water Authority.
